body.name: Thule Urban Glide 2 Jogging Stroller
features: An all-terrain double stroller perfect for jogging or strolling through town
Swivel front wheel locks into place for jogging
Large 16" rear wheels plus suspension for an ultra smooth ride
One-handed, compact fold to easily store and transport
Integrated twist hand brake provides speed control
Reclining seats with padded 5-point harness and ventilation
Ergonomic, adjustable handlebar with twist hand brake
Large storage basket with zip top cover
Sitting height: 21 inches; Door pass through: 31.5 inches; Product weight 33lbs
body.description: The Thule Urban Glide 2 is the perfect all terrain stroller for the active family. Whether you’re looking for a jogging stroller to take on your favorite path or a full size stroller to easily navigate throughout town, the Thule Urban Glide 2 delivers. Designed with a comfortable seat, a padded 5-point safety harness, and a multi-position canopy with ventilation, your precious cargo is sure to enjoy the ride. The silent, one-handed recline is perfect for naps on the go. This three wheel stroller provides an ultra smooth ride thanks to the large 16" rear wheels and suspension system. The front swivel wheel makes it easy to maneuver through town and locks into place for jogging. The integrated twist hand brake gives parents control of hilly terrain the adjustable handlebar provides an ergonomic grip for any sized adult. A magnetic peekaboo window allows you to check on your child without disturbing them, even while they sleep. Bring all you need for the day in the large cargo storage bin with a zip-top closure to keep all contents secure, even when folded. Storing and transporting a sport stroller has never been easier thanks to the one-handed compact fold. Simply slide and twist the release bar and the stroller folds in half. Remove the rear tires in seconds to make it even more compact. The Thule Urban Glide 2 can be used as an infant stroller from birth when using car seat adapters (sold separately). It can also transition into a toddler stroller and support a weight capacity of 75 lbs.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Swivel front wheel Easy to maneuver, thanks to swivel front wheel that locks into place for jogging, and to the 16" rear wheels. Compact fold One-handed, compact fold for easy storage and transportation. Ample storage Plenty of room to bring everything you need with a large cargo basket with zip-top cover, rear mesh pocket, and two mesh compartments for snacks and toys.

Integrated hand brake Integrated twist hand brake provides speed control on hilly terrain. Wrist strap for additional emergency brake. 5-point child harnesses Secure and comfortable seat with padded 5-point harness and integrated ventilation. Built-in suspension Suspension makes the ride smooth for both parent and children. Accessory compatible Compatible with a variety of Thule stroller accessories to customize it to your family's needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Best stroller and investment ever! I have the bin single stroller as well as britax b-free single stroller and needed to upgrade to a double as I had a second son… was debating between many doubles but so glad I got this one! It literally glides like butter on the ground, regardless of what you’re rolling on (concrete, dirt, grass etc) and also it feels like I am pushing air! It has no weight and I can easily go up and down hills without an issue or feeling heavy! I bought this vs the double bob given it has a hand brake (I like to rollerblade!) and also an infant seat adapter for my 3 month old. It seems easier to push then the bob, it’s also less bulky and much lighter to pick up, it’s very sturdy but Lightweight, and I know it will last us a few good years! I’m excited to take my kids to the park and adventures everyday in this stroller! It fits easily through a standard doorway and I can see myself taking it everywhere we go, it’s so nice, great looking and perfect! My son also likes the “big brother” stand I bought with it which fits perfectly (2 years old), and he also loved the seat, it’s comfy and the recline wasn’t too far back at all, it was a good angle and he could see just fine! He likes the big shade over his head too.. it completely blocked the sun! Also we have no issues with the wheels wobbling! Be weary of the negative reviews, until you try this gem out for yourself! My friend also has one and calls it GOLD! It really is. Invest in a good stroller, invest in THULE! :-)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love it. I have thoughts about the seat recline and the length/width.
reviews.reviewText: I love this stroller so far. It's light and easy to push. It looks sleek and modern and many people compliment on how "nice" our stroller looks. I can easily push it with one hand. Running with it is a dream. Buying the console gives you good storage. My toddler likes the additional snack tray purchase. Sun shade is big. There's even mesh pockets on the sides of the seat so my daughter can store a toy or two next to her. There's a mesh pocket behind the seat. I forgot a banana in there, folded the stroller, and the banana was fresh and unbruised the next day. It's pretty easy and intuitive to adjust the seat straps.My only complaints are very specific to my needs/preferences (mostly that I want my jogging stroller to also be my every day stroller):1. The seat's most upright position is slightly reclined. My daughter wants to sit all the way upright and so she is hesitant to get in the stroller for this reason. I understand that this is so the baby doesn't get whiplash from sudden starts and stops on a run, but since I like to use this stroller for everyday errands, I wish it could go completely upright. I read that the 2016 BOB now includes a complete upright position, so I hope one day Thule does the same.2. The stroller feels very LONG. I brought this stroller to Disneyland and it just felt slightly too big...not because of it's girth or profile (which are very sleek), but simply because of the length. It takes careful thought to maneuver in tight spaces, though the actual pushing and turning is very smooth, light and easy.3. The placement of the back two wheels feel slightly WIDE when indoors (yes I took this into a restaurant) and in crowds. Similar to my last point...the silhouette of the stroller seat is slim, it's just the wheel placement that sticks far out in front and a little wide in the back. If I wasn't mindful, I would accidentally bump into things. I wonder if the wheel placement has something to do with the aerodynamics of the running stroller? If so I'm not complaining.My dream is that Thule (are you reading this Thule?) would consider a model with front and back wheels that sit more underneath the child seat instead of sticking out as much, and a more upright sitting position. Then this would be the ultimate only-stroller-you-ever-need-in-life stroller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I wanted a jogging stroller with a brake that I could rollerblade with safely. [I'm not advocating using this for rollerblading, this is a don't-try-this-at-home kind of warning]The front wheel has a nice pseudo-lock mechanism to it so you can switch from walking/maneuverable to running/limited turning mode.The wheels are the perfect size, glides easily and silently.It seems very well made, the material has held up to the sun, the canopy and ventilation is great.The braking works well enough for rollerblading, you have to turn it pretty hard though. Wouldn't be able to stop you going down a hill if you had any speed.There have been complaints about the latch breaking when you lift it when it's folded, so I've been very careful not to put all the weight on the latch when lifting. I haven't had problems with it, but I could see how that could break if you weren't careful.The stroller folds up very easily (took a little getting used to though), and the handlebars adjust easily, which makes it very easy to fit in the trunk and adjust for height. That's very important because I'm both fairly tall (6') and when I'm on rollerblades I get another 4". My wife is much shorter so the handlebars have a large comfort range.Next up is the storage area. No water bottle holder, but the storage base is very nice. It both has velcro for quick in and out and a zipper if you wanted to seal the whole thing up.Worth the price, using it every day!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Stroller For Runners -Very Durable
reviews.reviewText: I give the Thule Urban Glide 2 Jogging Stroller a raving 5-star review! This stroller is an absolute game changer for active parents. It is designed for jogging and provides a smooth and stable ride for both parent and child. The stroller is lightweight and easy to maneuver, making it perfect for city streets or off-road adventures. The swivel front wheel allows for easy navigation in tight spaces, while the locking feature provides added stability when jogging. The adjustable handlebar and hand-operated rear drum brakes are a plus, giving me full control of the stroller at all times. The seat is also very comfortable and spacious, providing plenty of room for my child to grow. The canopy provides ample shade and the adjustable calf support is great for little legs. The stroller also has a large storage basket and a water-resistant phone pocket. Overall, I highly recommend the Thule Urban Glide 2 Jogging Stroller for anyone looking for a high-performance and versatile stroller for their active lifestyle.

reviews.reviewTitle: note manufacture date is 06/2021 a full 30 months ago???
reviews.reviewText: Perfectly good MODEL Urban Glide 2 i was surprised it was manufactured 29/30 months agogood sale price apparently GLIDE 3 is out or coming out soonwe have newborn so i needed to buy the attachment (be sure to check what is needed before you buy)

reviews.reviewTitle: False advertising? Is it all-terrain or isn't it? Is it for jogging or isn't it?
reviews.reviewText: I like the sturdiness of the frame. It is big and bulky and tough to fit in the trunk, but it seems like it would be worth it.The lifetime warranty is nice, however you must follow the rules in the instruction manual in order to qualify. Note the pictures I have attached. It is advertised as an all-terrain stroller, however in the first page of the instructions it says not to use the carrier on rough off-road terrain. How does that make sense? If they don't qualify this exactly, it gives an excuse for the manufacturer to void the warranty. In addition, it mentions in the manual that it is not for running... They need to define the exact speed limits between running and jogging. I am 6'2", my wife is 5'2". Jogging for me is running for her.We will likely return based solely on the fact that we have heard nightmares about getting Thule to honour warranty requests, and these loopholes written into the manual seems to give them the ability to squirm out of anything.

Love this stroller! I’m glad I went with this jogger for a number of reasons: it manoeuvres so easily making sharp turns and awkward movements a breeze, it has a handle break and great park break, lots of storage underneath that is covered and some back pocket storage, big canopy with a peek a boo window and optional mess sides for breathability, folds up quite easily and small especially for a jogger and is a 1 hand fold! It’s light enough to be lifted with one hand, quality is great and the stroller looks really nice and very sleek. I highly recommend this for anyone who does a lot of walking and jogging but also wants something you can take into the grocery store or mall easily.
Velmi praktický kočárek. Výborný v terénu i ve městě, nekodrcá a přejede spoustu překážek.
